intro: Galium labradoricum, commonly known as Labrador bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers in late summer, which are followed by small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in bogs, fens, and other wetland habitats. Due to its delicate appearance and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable component of its native ecosystems.
